titleStmt.title: Oxford Board of Commission Meeting, Feb. 19 1866, an electronic edition

publicationStmt.publisher: Emory University, Lewis H. Beck Center

sourceDesc.bibl: Oxford Board of Commission Meeting, Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University.

projectDesc.p: This text was created by the Lewis H. Beck Center as a part of the Oxford Experience Project. Project participants intend for this encoded text, as well as all texts produced by this project, to be made available on the web for educational, scholarly and pedagogical purposes.

samplingDecl.p: The archival material has been transcribed and encoded. Paratextual elements may be provided as digital images only, with some exceptions.

editorialDecl.p: Processing this electronic text file began by creating TIFF images of each page using either a flatbed scanner. Text pages were captured in color at 300dpi. These digital images were converted to an electronic text file by transcription. The text files produced have been proofread against the original document or a JPEG image of the original. This proofread text file has then been encoded using the recommendations for Level 3 of the TEI in Libraries Guidelines. For the details of Level 3 encoding, please see the webpage for TEI Guidelines for Best Encoding practices at http://www.indiana.edu/~letrs/tei/. Encoders silently replaced em dashes with two dashes. Page numbers and other text such as titles displayed in brackets have been added by the encoder and do not appear in the original text.

revisionDesc.change: On 2009-10-06 Daniel Ledford and Paul Han and Erica Dawkins and Imari Daniels and Breanna McIntosh transcribed and encoded the document.

div.head: Oxford Board of Commission Meeting
div.p: The Grand Council assembled at place & time previously designated proves both, CafersCafers absent. After the usual Ceremonies of Opening, The Journal of last meeting read and adopted as Correct.
The High Marshall reports that the parents of the boys recently fined for violation of Ordinance against Shooting refuse to meet his modest & polite demand for the fine imposed.
The Dignity of this Board has vindicated in a resolution which requires the Marshall to Levy an Execution for the recovery of said fine.

His honor, Commissioner EvansCommissioner Evans moved a resolution, to Levy a Tax of One Dollar on Each male Citizens, 21 years of age & over which resolution is offered as an Amendment to the Ordinance on taxation -- Passed and ordered to be attached as an Amendment to the Tax Bill.
There being nothing beyond this to Engage the Mind and heart of their August body they adjourned to meet again on next Monday night

signed.unclear: Tarborrough, Inv N.Inv N. Tarborrough 2nd + G.H.P.

closer.signed: Means, Olin S.Olin S. Means, Secty
